analyzed: aa bhy'as med pa ste sngar byings lan gnyis byas zin yin na slar lan gnyis su me 'gyur bas /
translated: Since abhya means “without,” if the root has already been used twice previously, it will not be used again twice.

original: sngar gnyis su ma 'gyur ba aa bhy'a sa med pa'i byings de ni lit pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur ro //🔽ae k'a tso dve pra tha ma sya /
analyzed: sngar gnyis su ma 'gyur ba aa bhy'a sa med pa'i byings de ni lit pha rol la gnyis su 'gyur ro // ae k'a tso dve pra tha ma sya /
translated: The former, which is the root avya, meaning “not two,” becomes dvi, “two,” in the sense of “other.”🔽Eka-ac-co-dvi-prathama-asya.

original: @198a * // aatsa gcig pa'i dang po'i gnyis so //
analyzed: @198a * // aatsa gcig pa'i dang po'i gnyis so //
translated: “ One, ac, co, dvi, first, of it.”

original: sngar bshad pa ltar aa bhy'as med pa'i byings yin pa de yang aa tsa gcig pa'i byings yin na de'i mtha' na hal yod kyang lit pha rol la dang po de gnyis su 'gyur ro //🔽p'u rbo& bhy'a sa:/
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar aa bhy'as med pa'i byings yin pa de yang aa tsa gcig pa'i byings yin na de'i mtha' na hal yod kyang lit pha rol la dang po de gnyis su 'gyur ro // p'u rbo& bhy'a sa:/
translated: As explained above, the root avya, meaning “not two,” is also the root ac, meaning “one.” Even though the syllable ha is at the end of it, it becomes dvi, “two,” in the sense of “other.”🔽Pūrva-avya-as.

original: snga ma aa bhy'a sa'o //
analyzed: snga ma aa bhy'a sa'o //
translated: “ Former, avya, as.”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar byings lan gnyis brjod pa'i lnga ma de la aa bhy'a sa zhes ming 'dogs byed do //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar byings lan gnyis brjod pa'i lnga ma de la aa bhy'a sa zhes ming 'dogs byed do //
translated: As explained above, the fifth of the roots that are repeated twice is called avya.🔽Hrasva.

original: hra sva:/ thung ngu'o //
analyzed: hra sva:/ thung ngu'o //
translated: “ Short.”

original: byings gnyis brjod pa'i snga ma aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ni aatsa ting po yin na thung ngur 'gyur ro //🔽aa bhy'a se tsa rtstsa /
analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i snga ma aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ni aatsa ting po yin na thung ngur 'gyur ro // aa bhy'a se tsa rtstsa /
translated: The former of the roots that are repeated twice, which is called avya, becomes short if it is ac, meaning “one.”🔽Avya-se-car-ac.

original: aa bhy'a sa la tsar'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar'ang ngo //
translated: “ Avya, se, ca, and ac.”

original: aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de dzhal so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yin na tsar so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge dang 'ang ge sgras dzasha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams su 'gyur te /🔽de yang dzha la so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams kyi nang nas kha ya so sor bsdu ba rnams tsar so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge sde pa dang skye gnas mthun pa rnams su 'gyur la /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de dzhal so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yin na tsar so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge dang 'ang ge sgras dzasha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams su 'gyur te / de yang dzha la so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams kyi nang nas kha ya so sor bsdu ba rnams tsar so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge sde pa dang skye gnas mthun pa rnams su 'gyur la /
translated: If the name of the avyayibhāva is a letter that is included in the jhalla, then the letter that is included in the tsa, and the letter that is included in the jha become the letters that are included in the ja.🔽Moreover, among the letters that are included in the jhalla, the letters that are included in the kha and ya become the letters that are included in the tsa, and they are of the same class and origin.

original: de 'phros kyi dzhal gyi yi ge rnams sde pa gcig cing skye gnas mthun pa'i dza sha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams su 'gyur ro //🔽bha ba te ra:/
analyzed: de 'phros kyi dzhal gyi yi ge rnams sde pa gcig cing skye gnas mthun pa'i dza sha so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge rnams su 'gyur ro // bha ba te ra:/
translated: The remaining letters of the jhalla are of the same class and origin, and they become the letters that are included in the ja and jha.🔽Bhavatī

original: bha ba ti'i aa'o //
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa'o //

original: bha ba ti ste byings bh'u gnyis brjod pa'i snga ma aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de'i au ni lit pha rol la aa yig tu 'gyur ro //

translated: The va of bhavati becomes vi.🔽The la of liṭ becomes su.🔽The na of parasmātpada becomes ṇa.🔽The ṇa of abhyāsa becomes ṇa.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa ru song /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa ru song /
translated: The au of bhavati becomes o.🔽The la of abhyāsa becomes va.

analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'os bha ba dh'u'i bu ka 'os buka a'a ga @199a * //
translated: The bu of bhavati becomes buka. The following ga of agam becomes u.

original: ma ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait a'a ga ma ta gnas don ba ai la drangs /
analyzed: ma ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait a'a ga ma ta gnas don ba ai la drangs /
translated: The words ma, ka, and gha are the bases for the meaning of place. The word u is the base for the meaning of expression. The word vya is the base for the meaning of half. The word ita is the base for the meaning of fit. The word āgata is the base for the meaning of place. The word va is the base for the meaning of water.

original: ba bh'u bi ma/.. ..(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la mas su bsgyur /
analyzed: ba bh'u bi ma/.. ..(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la mas su bsgyur /
translated: The word bhu is the base for the meaning of earth. The word li is the base for the meaning of after. The word ma is the base for the meaning of later.

original: pa rasmee pa da rnams kyi nal aa tus aus thal aa thus aa nal /
analyzed: pa rasmee pa da rnams kyi nal aa tus aus thal aa thus aa nal /
translated: The words para, sma, and pada are the bases for the meaning of self. The word āt is the base for the meaning of u. The word ath is the base for the meaning of a. The word na is the base for the meaning of self.

original: wa tus aus thal aa thus aa nal /
analyzed: wa tus aus thal aa thus aa nal /
translated: The word va is the base for the meaning of u. The word ath is the base for the meaning of a. The word na is the base for the meaning of self.

original: wa ma rnams sos mas mar bsgyur /
analyzed: wa ma rnams sos mas mar bsgyur /
translated: The words va and ma are the bases for the meaning of later.

original: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The word li is the base for the meaning of the absence of the base abhaya. The two bases are expressed.

original: thung ngu 'os a'a thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'a thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: The base for the meaning of short is changed to the short a.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa ru song /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa ru song /
translated: The a of bhavati becomes u.

original: aa bhy'as la tsar 'os bha bar bsgyur bh'u'i buka 'os /
analyzed: aa bhy'as la tsar 'os bha bar bsgyur bh'u'i buka 'os /
translated: The base for the meaning of la is changed to bha by abhaya. The suffix bhu is appropriate.

original: buka a'a gam byin ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don wa\ ai la drangs /
analyzed: buka a'a gam byin ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don wa\ ai la drangs /
translated: The word bhu is the base for the meaning of come. The word ka is the base for the meaning of place. The word u is the base for the meaning of expression. The word vya is the base for the meaning of half. The word ita is the base for the meaning of fit. The word āgata is the base for the meaning of place. The word va is the base for the meaning of water.

original: de rnams li ta'i pa rasmee bad rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams li ta'i pa rasmee bad rnams so //
translated: These are the words of li, para, sma, and pada.

original: bh'u thob pa la'o zhes pa la a'atma ne pa da rnams byin pa'i dper brjod ni /
analyzed: bh'u thob pa la'o zhes pa la a'atma ne pa da rnams byin pa'i dper brjod ni /

original: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
analyzed: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
translated: For the first person singular of the Līṭī aṇipada,

original: lit sta dzha yo re shi re tsa /🔽li ta'i ta dzha dag gi ae sha ai re tsa'o //🔽lit 'gyur ba'i a'atma ne pa da'i ta yig ni ae sha dang dzha yig ni ai retsa zhes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lit sta dzha yo re shi re tsa / li ta'i ta dzha dag gi ae sha ai re tsa'o // lit 'gyur ba'i a'atma ne pa da'i ta yig ni ae sha dang dzha yig ni ai retsa zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: lītaḥ,🔽the aṇ becomes e and the ja becomes i.🔽The aṇ of līta becomes e and the ja becomes i.

original: ba bh'u be/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la ta du bsgyur /
analyzed: ba bh'u be/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la ta du bsgyur /
translated: After the addition of the suffix, the la becomes ta.

original: mdo 'dis ta ae shar bsgyur /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ta ae shar bsgyur /
translated: This sūtra changes ta to e.

original: mtha'i hal 'os sha phyis /
analyzed: mtha'i hal 'os sha phyis /
translated: The final ha is elided because of the śa.

original: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: In līta, the two root letters of the avaya, which are not elided, are shortened, and the short a of the suffix becomes a.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar song /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar song /
translated: The a of bhavati becomes u.

original: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur /
translated: The b of abhyāsas becomes bha.

original: bh'u'i buka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma byin ka gnas don au brjod don wa ae la drangs /
analyzed: bh'u'i buka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma byin ka gnas don au brjod don wa ae la drangs /
translated: The b of bhū becomes bukam, which is given the agam, and the ka remains for the sake of the meaning. The u is pronounced as e.

original: li ta'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gnyis tshig la /🔽ba bh'u b'a te/...(bh'u la) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: li ta'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gnyis tshig la / ba bh'u b'a te/...(bh'u la) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: In the first person dual of the Līṭī aṇ-preter,🔽the -āte is changed to -āva (the -ā of bhavati is changed to -āva).

original: la a'a t'am du bsgyur /
analyzed: la a'a t'am du bsgyur /
translated: The -ā is changed to -āṃ.

original: ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' aer 'gyur /
analyzed: ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' aer 'gyur /
translated: The -te is changed to -āva.

original: lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: In Līṭī, the two-syllable root with the avayava a is changed to the short -u.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur aa bhy'as la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur /🔽bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur aa bhy'as la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur / bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin /
translated: The -a of bhavati is changed to -u. The -la of avayava is changed to -va.🔽The -te of bhavati is changed to -t.

original: ka gnas don au brjod don wa\ a'a la drangs /
analyzed: ka gnas don au brjod don wa\ a'a la drangs /
translated: The -a of bhavati is changed to -u. The -u of avayava is changed to -va.

original: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i mang tshig la /
analyzed: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i mang tshig la /
translated: In the plural of the first person of the Līṭī aṇ-preter,

original: ba bh'u bi re/...(bh'u la lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la dzhar bsgyur /
analyzed: ba bh'u bi re/...(bh'u la lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la dzhar bsgyur /
translated: the -āte is changed to -āva (the -ā of bhavati is changed to -āva).

original: lita'i ta dzha dag gi ae sha ai ritsa 'os dzha ai re tsar bsgyur /🔽mtha'i hal 'os tsa phyis lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: lita'i ta dzha dag gi ae sha ai ritsa 'os dzha ai re tsar bsgyur /🔽mtha'i hal 'os tsa phyis lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The -ā of Līṭī and the -te of bhavati are changed to -āva.🔽The -te of bhavati is changed to -t.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /🔽bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur / bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate short vowel is changed to a short u.🔽The appropriate a of bhavat is changed to u.🔽The appropriate ca of abhaya is changed to tsa.

original: aabhy'as la tsar 'os /
analyzed: aabhy'as la tsar 'os /
translated: The appropriate bhu of bhava is changed to bu.🔽The appropriate ka of bhuka is changed to ka.🔽The appropriate agama of agama is changed to u.🔽The appropriate vṛddhi of vṛddhi is changed to i.

original: bha ba / bh'u'i bu ka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma ga gnas don au brjod don yin pas phyis /
analyzed: bha ba / bh'u'i bu ka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma ga gnas don au brjod don yin pas phyis /
translated: The appropriate la of vṛddhi is changed to la.

original: wa ai la drangs/) li ta'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: wa ai la drangs/) li ta'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: The appropriate li of vṛddhi is changed to li.🔽The appropriate ta of vṛddhi is changed to ta.🔽The appropriate ṭa of vṛddhi is changed to ṭa.🔽The appropriate ḍa of vṛddhi is changed to ḍa.🔽The appropriate da of vṛddhi is changed to da.🔽The appropriate pa of vṛddhi is changed to pa.🔽The appropriate pha of vṛddhi is changed to pha.🔽The appropriate ba of vṛddhi is changed to ba.

original: ba bh'u bi she/...(bh'u la /
analyzed: ba bh'u bi she/...(bh'u la /
translated: The appropriate bha of vṛddhi is changed to bha.🔽The appropriate ya of vṛddhi is changed to ya.🔽The appropriate ra of vṛddhi is changed to ra.

original: lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la th'as su bsgyur /
analyzed: lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la th'as su bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate la of vṛddhi is changed to la.🔽The appropriate va of vṛddhi is changed to va.🔽The appropriate śa of vṛddhi is changed to śa.🔽The appropriate ṣa of vṛddhi is changed to ṣa.🔽The appropriate sa of vṛddhi is changed to sa.

original: th'as kyi se 'os th'as ser bsgyur /🔽lit la byings ya @199b bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: th'as kyi se 'os th'as ser bsgyur / lit la byings ya @199b bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The appropriate ha of vṛddhi is changed to ha.🔽The appropriate kṣa of vṛddhi is changed to kṣa.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate a of vṛddhi is changed to a.🔽The appropriate ā of vṛddhi is changed to ā.🔽The appropriate i of vṛddhi is changed to i.🔽The appropriate ī of vṛddhi is changed to ī.🔽The appropriate u of vṛddhi is changed to u.🔽The appropriate ū of vṛddhi is changed to ū.🔽The appropriate e of vṛddhi is changed to e.🔽The appropriate ai of vṛddhi is changed to ai.🔽The appropriate o of vṛddhi is changed to o.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar song aa bhy'a la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur /🔽bh'u'i bu ga 'os bug a'a ga ma ka gnas don au brjod don byings byed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don bra ai la drangs /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar song aa bhy'a la tsar 'os bha war bsgyur /🔽bh'u'i bu ga 'os bug a'a ga ma ka gnas don au brjod don byings byed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don bra ai la drangs /
translated: The appropriate au of vṛddhi is changed

original: kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sha/) ba bh'u b'a tha/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sha/) ba bh'u b'a tha/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: 3. The suffix la becomes tha.🔽4. The root ta becomes e.

original: la a'a th'am du bsgyur /🔽ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' ae lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: la a'a th'am du bsgyur / ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' ae lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: 5. The root ava becomes a.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /🔽bha ba ti aa 'os au aa /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur / bha ba ti aa 'os au aa /
translated: 6. The short u becomes a.🔽7. The root bhava becomes bhu.

original: aa bhy 'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy 'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
translated: 8. The root ava becomes ca.

original: bh'u'i buka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma byin /
analyzed: bh'u'i buka 'os bu ka a'a ga ma byin /
translated: 9. The root bhu becomes bhuka.

original: ka gnas don au brjod don wa a'a la drangs /🔽ba bh'u bidhve /
analyzed: ka gnas don au brjod don wa a'a la drangs / ba bh'u bidhve /
translated: 10. The root ka becomes u.🔽11. The root bhu becomes bhidva.

original: ba bh'u bi dhve /
analyzed: ba bh'u bi dhve /
translated: 12. The root bhu becomes vidva.🔽13. The suffix la becomes dva.🔽14. The root ta becomes e.🔽15. The root ava becomes a.

original: (bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la dhva du bsgyur ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' ae lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /🔽thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur song /🔽bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
analyzed: (bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas la dhva du bsgyur ta 'gro ba sogs kyis mtha' ae lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod / thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur song / bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
translated: 16. The root ava becomes ca.🔽17. The root bhava becomes bhu.🔽18. The root ava becomes ca.

original: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
translated: 19. The root bhu becomes bhuka.🔽20. The root ka becomes u.

original: bh'u'i buka 'os bug a'a ga ma byin /
analyzed: bh'u'i buka 'os bug a'a ga ma byin /
translated: The root bhu becomes buk, and the root ā becomes āg.

original: ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i wal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don aita'i 'dam ka 'os dha dhar 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang na ba byas ba'o /
analyzed: ka gnas don au brjod don byings phyed pa'i wal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don aita'i 'dam ka 'os dha dhar 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang na ba byas ba'o /
translated: The root ka becomes u, and the root ā becomes āg.

original: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: lita'i a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: The root li becomes āt, and the root ta becomes ne.

original: ba bh'u be/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: ba bh'u be/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: The root bhu becomes ve, and the root li becomes ta.🔽The root la becomes īt, and the root ta becomes kha.🔽The root a becomes ā, and the root bhu becomes buk.🔽The root ā becomes āg, and the root ka becomes u.🔽The root va becomes ai, and the root e becomes ai.🔽The root bhu becomes vi, and the root li becomes ta.🔽The root la becomes bhe, and the root ta becomes bhe.

original: la ai tar bsgyur ta khyad don ta 'gro ba sogs kyis ai aa lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: la ai tar bsgyur ta khyad don ta 'gro ba sogs kyis ai aa lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: The root li becomes a, and the root a becomes ā.🔽The root bhu becomes u, and the root buk becomes buk.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin ka gnas don au brjod don /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aa bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin ka gnas don au brjod don /
translated: The root ā becomes āg, and the root ka becomes u.

original: wa\ ae la drangs /🔽ba bh'u bi pa he/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /🔽la ba hir bsgyur /
analyzed: wa\ ae la drangs / ba bh'u bi pa he/...(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas / la ba hir bsgyur /
translated: The root va becomes ai, and the root e becomes ai.🔽The root bhu becomes vi, and the root li becomes ta.🔽The root la becomes bhe, and the root ta becomes bhe.

original: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: lit la byings aa bhy'as med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The root li becomes a, and the root a becomes ā.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /🔽bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur / bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate short vowel is changed to a short u.🔽The appropriate a of bhavat is changed to u.

original: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha par bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha par bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate a of abhyasa is changed to ca.

original: byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait byin ta gnas don /
analyzed: byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait byin ta gnas don /
translated: The appropriate ita of the half-base bala is given ita, the meaning of which is “to remain.”

original: bh'u'i bu ka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin /
analyzed: bh'u'i bu ka 'os buka a'a ga ma byin /
translated: The appropriate buka of bhavu is given buka, the meaning of which is “to come.”

original: ka gnas don au brjod don wa ai la drangs /🔽ba bh'u bi ma he/.. ..(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: ka gnas don au brjod don wa ai la drangs / ba bh'u bi ma he/.. ..(bh'u la/) lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: The appropriate u of ka, the meaning of which is “to remain,” is drawn to the i of the expression.🔽The appropriate mahe of bhuvi is changed to mahi.

original: la ma hing du bsgyur /
analyzed: la ma hing du bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate li of lita is changed to du.

original: nga so sor bsdu ba'i don lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: nga so sor bsdu ba'i don lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The appropriate two bases of lita, which means “to collect individually,” are expressed.

original: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
analyzed: thung ngu 'os a'u thung ngur bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate short vowel is changed to a short u.

original: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa 'os au aar bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate a of bhavat is changed to u.

original: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa la tsar 'ang ngos bha bar bsgyur /
translated: The appropriate a of abhyasa is changed to ca.

original: byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma ka gnas don au brjod don wa\ ai la drangs /
analyzed: byings phyed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait ta gnas don bh'u'i buka 'os buka a'a ga ma ka gnas don au brjod don wa\ ai la drangs /
translated: The appropriate ita of the half-base bala is given ita, the meaning of which is “to remain.” The appropriate buka of bhavu is given buka, the meaning of which is “to come.” The appropriate u of ka, the meaning of which is “to remain,” is drawn to the i of the expression.

original: de rnams lit ste 'di dang tsandra par lit zer la /
analyzed: de rnams lit ste 'di dang tsandra par lit zer la /
translated: Those are lit, and this is called candrapālit.

original: ka l'a pa dang dbyangs can by'a ka ra na gnyis su lkog gyur gyi rnam dbye zhes zer ro //🔽aa na dya ta ne lut /
analyzed: ka l'a pa dang dbyangs can by'a ka ra na gnyis su lkog gyur gyi rnam dbye zhes zer ro // aa na dya ta ne lut /
translated: The Kalāpa and Sarasvatī are called the hidden case.🔽anadyataneluta

original: de ring ma yin pa la @200a * //
analyzed: de ring ma yin pa la @200a * //
translated: Not today.

original: luta'o // de ring yod pa ma yin pa 'byung 'gyur gyi don la 'jug pa'i bya ba'i don la byings la lut 'jug ste /
analyzed: luta'o // de ring yod pa ma yin pa 'byung 'gyur gyi don la 'jug pa'i bya ba'i don la byings la lut 'jug ste /
translated: Luta is used for the meaning of the future, which does not exist today. The verbal root luta is used for the meaning of an action.

original: de yang ma 'ongs pa shin tu dus thag ring ba ma yin pa la 'jug pa shas che'o //🔽sya t'a s'i lri lu to:/
analyzed: de yang ma 'ongs pa shin tu dus thag ring ba ma yin pa la 'jug pa shas che'o // sya t'a s'i lri lu to:/
translated: Moreover, it is used for the future that is not very far away.🔽syatāsīlṛlutāḥ

original: sya t'a sa dag lri lut dag la'o //
analyzed: sya t'a sa dag lri lut dag la'o //
translated: Syatāsīlṛlutāḥ are in syatāsīlṛlut.

original: byings la lri zhes pa lring dang lring dag gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: byings la lri zhes pa lring dang lring dag gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The verbal root lṛ is to be taken as lṛṅ and lṛt.

original: lring dang lrit dag pha rol la sya ster zhing lut pha rol la t'as sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lring dang lrit dag pha rol la sya ster zhing lut pha rol la t'as sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Lṛṅ and lṛt give syat to the other, and lṛt gives tā to the other.

original: lut:pra tha ma sya d'a roo ra sa:lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi d'a ro ras rnams so //
analyzed: lut:pra tha ma sya d'a roo ra sa:lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi d'a ro ras rnams so //
translated: lut prathamasya syādāro raḥ lūtī, the first luts give āro raḥ.

original: lut bsgyur ba'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po rnams dang / a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po rnams ni rim pa bzhin d'a roo ras rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lut bsgyur ba'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po rnams dang / a'atma ne pa da'i skyes bu dang po rnams ni rim pa bzhin d'a roo ras rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The first persons of the Parasmaipada of the Luti conjugation and the first persons of the Atmane pada are, respectively, the Darbhas of the Parasmaipada.

original: de dag ni dper brjod rim pa bzhin pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
analyzed: de dag ni dper brjod rim pa bzhin pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
translated: The examples are, respectively, the singular of the first person of the Parasmaipada of the Luti conjugation.

original: bha bi t'a/...(bh'u la /
analyzed: bha bi t'a/...(bh'u la /
translated: Bhavita,

original: de ring ma yin pa la lut 'os lut byin ta tita kyi don /
analyzed: de ring ma yin pa la lut 'os lut byin ta tita kyi don /
translated: The meaning of the Taddhita affix tita, which is appropriate for the non-present, is given as tita.

original: au lu ta'i dang po sogs kyi khyad don la tipa tu 'gyur /
analyzed: au lu ta'i dang po sogs kyi khyad don la tipa tu 'gyur /
translated: The special meaning of the first ula is given as tipa.

original: lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi d'a roo ras rnams sos tipa d'a ru bsgyur /
analyzed: lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi d'a roo ras rnams sos tipa d'a ru bsgyur /
translated: The Darbhas of the first luti are given as tipada.

original: da di ta la ti dbyi ba'i don sya t'as dag wi lut dag la 'os t'as byin ti'i 'os ti phyis ta drangs /🔽byings byed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait byin /
analyzed: da di ta la ti dbyi ba'i don sya t'as dag wi lut dag la 'os t'as byin ti'i 'os ti phyis ta drangs /🔽byings byed pa'i bal la ait 'os ait byin /
translated: The meaning of the Taddhita affix tita is given as tya by the Taddhita tika.🔽The affix ita is given as ita.

original: byings thams cad pa dang byings byed ba dag gi 'os byings la yon tan aetsa sogs kyis ao aa wa wa\ ai la drangs/) lu ta'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gnyis tshig la /
analyzed: byings thams cad pa dang byings byed ba dag gi 'os byings la yon tan aetsa sogs kyis ao aa wa wa\ ai la drangs/) lu ta'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gnyis tshig la /
translated: In the case of the second member of the first person of the Parasmaipad of Luti,

original: ritsa / ra la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ritsa / ra la 'ang ngo //
translated: the ra is also elided after the ra.

original: ra yig pha rol la t'a sa dang byings aas yod pa dag gis yig srog med ni dbyi ste /
analyzed: ra yig pha rol la t'a sa dang byings aas yod pa dag gis yig srog med ni dbyi ste /
translated: When the ra is followed by a ta and the root has an a, the life-letter is elided.🔽bhavitāro

original: bha bi t'a roo/...(bh'u la /
analyzed: bha bi t'a roo/...(bh'u la /
translated: bhaula

original: lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: lit rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: After the connection with lit,

original: la tas su bsgyur lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi zhes bas tas roo ru bsgyur /
analyzed: la tas su bsgyur lu ta'i dang po rnams kyi zhes bas tas roo ru bsgyur /

original: ` mantha srub pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la lata sogs la yig bcu bo'i bar smee pad rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga thams cad bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra la /
analyzed: ` mantha srub pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la lata sogs la yig bcu bo'i bar smee pad rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga thams cad bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra la /
translated: All the rules for adding the me pad of the root manthā, “to churn,” to the lat and so on up to the tenth case are the same as those just explained.

original: 'on kyang smon pa'i ling la ai 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams kyi hal au pa dh'a'i kang 'gro ba la'o zhes pas na dbyi ba lo na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang smon pa'i ling la ai 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams kyi hal au pa dh'a'i kang 'gro ba la'o zhes pas na dbyi ba lo na ste /
translated: But in the optative, the hal aupadha goes to the a of the optative, and the a of the optative goes to the a of the optative.

original: lat la / mantha ti sogs so //🔽ling la / manthe ta sogs dang / lot la /🔽mantha tu sogs dang / lang la /
analyzed: lat la / mantha ti sogs so // ling la / manthe ta sogs dang / lot la / mantha tu sogs dang / lang la /
translated: In the present, manthati, etc.🔽In the optative, manthita, etc.🔽In the imperative, manthatu, etc.

original: aa manthata sogs so //🔽lung la / aa manth'ita sogs dang / lit la /
analyzed: aa manthata sogs so // lung la / aa manth'ita sogs dang / lit la /
translated: In the conditional, a manthata, etc.🔽In the potential, a manthiti, etc.

original: mamantha / mantha tu:/🔽sogs so // lut la /
analyzed: mamantha / mantha tu:/ sogs so // lut la /

original: manthi t'a / sogs so //🔽smon ba'i ling la /
analyzed: manthi t'a / sogs so // smon ba'i ling la /

original: smon pa la kita'o zhes pas na phyis /🔽ma thy'ata sogs so //🔽lrit la manthi shya ti sogs so //
analyzed: smon pa la kita'o zhes pas na phyis / ma thy'ata sogs so // lrit la manthi shya ti sogs so //
translated: In the optative of the optative, the optative goes to the optative.🔽In the conditional of the optative, the conditional goes to the optative.

original: lring la aa manthi shyata sogs te /
analyzed: lring la aa manthi shyata sogs te /
translated: In the potential of the optative, the potential goes to the optative.

original: bya ba lhag po dang mi 'dra ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: bya ba lhag po dang mi 'dra ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all in the remaining verbs.

original: ai di to num dh'a to /
analyzed: ai di to num dh'a to /
translated: In the present, idanūm dhato.

original: aita (brtsegs pa ma yin pa la lit kita'o zhes byung bas 'dir brtsegs pa yin pas lit kita ma yin pas na mi dbyi'o/) /'gro ba'i byings kyi nu ma'o //
analyzed: aita (brtsegs pa ma yin pa la lit kita'o zhes byung bas 'dir brtsegs pa yin pas lit kita ma yin pas na mi dbyi'o/) /'gro ba'i byings kyi nu ma'o //
translated: The root to go has the feminine form it.

original: byings ku thi lta bu aita 'gro ba rnams kyi pha rol tu ming du bsgrubs pa'i rkyen dang / tshig tu bsgrubs pa'i rkyen gang byung yang byings de la num a'a gam ster te ma gnas don dang au brjod don no//
analyzed: byings ku thi lta bu aita 'gro ba rnams kyi pha rol tu ming du bsgrubs pa'i rkyen dang / tshig tu bsgrubs pa'i rkyen gang byung yang byings de la num a'a gam ster te ma gnas don dang au brjod don no//
translated: When the root to go is used in the sense of to reach the other side, it is given the feminine form it, whether it is used as a nominal stem or a verbal stem.

original: ` byings ku ti 'tshe ba dang nyon mongs pa dag la'o zhes pa la lat sogs pa rasmee ba da rnams sbyar ba'i lat la /
analyzed: ` byings ku ti 'tshe ba dang nyon mongs pa dag la'o zhes pa la lat sogs pa rasmee ba da rnams sbyar ba'i lat la /

original: kuntha ti sogs so //🔽ling la / kunthi ta sogs so //🔽lot la / kuntha tu sogs so //
analyzed: kuntha ti sogs so // ling la / kunthi ta sogs so // lot la / kuntha tu sogs so //
translated: The form kuṭhāti, etc., is formed by adding lat.🔽 The form kuṭhīlati, etc., is formed by adding lin.🔽 The form kuṭhantu, etc., is formed by adding lat.

original: lang la / aa kunthata sogs so //
analyzed: lang la / aa kunthata sogs so //

original: lung la aa kanth'ita sogs so //🔽lit la / ku hoshtsu: ku ha dag gi tsu'o //
analyzed: lung la aa kanth'ita sogs so //🔽lit la / ku hoshtsu: ku ha dag gi tsu'o //

original: byings gnyis brjod pa'i aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ku ste ka sde yin na grangs mthun pa'i tsa sngar 'gyur zhing ha yig yin na dzaha yig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ku ste ka sde yin na grangs mthun pa'i tsa sngar 'gyur zhing ha yig yin na dzaha yig tu 'gyur la /
translated: If the two-syllable root with the name abhyāsa is ku, it is the ka class, and the ca becomes ca in the same number. If the syllable is ha, it becomes ja.

original: a dzha yig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: a dzha yig tu 'gyur la /
translated: It becomes a jha.🔽And that jha also becomes ja, because of the abhyāsa of ca.

original: dzha de yang aa bhy'a sa'i car 'ang ngo zhes pas dza yig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dzha de yang aa bhy'a sa'i car 'ang ngo zhes pas dza yig tu 'gyur te /
translated: It becomes ja.

original: tsu kuntha / tsu kuntha tu: tsu kunthu: sogs so //🔽lut la / kunthi t'a sogs dang / smon pa'i ling la skabs 'dir ai 'gro ba'i nus yin pas na\ mi dbyi /🔽kunthy'a ta sogs so //🔽lrit la / kunthi shya ti sogs so //
analyzed: tsu kuntha / tsu kuntha tu: tsu kunthu: sogs so // lut la / kunthi t'a sogs dang / smon pa'i ling la skabs 'dir ai 'gro ba'i nus yin pas na\ mi dbyi / kunthy'a ta sogs so // lrit la / kunthi shya ti sogs so //
translated: For example, cu kuntha, cu kuntha tuḥ, cu kunthut, and so on.🔽In lut, it is kunthitā and so on.

original: lring la / aa kunthi shya ta sogs te rigs 'gre'o //
analyzed: lring la / aa kunthi shya ta sogs te rigs 'gre'o //
translated: In lṛt, it is kunthiśyati and so on.🔽In lṛṅ, it is akunthiśyati and so on.

original: dh'a tv'a de:sha:sa: byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa'o //
analyzed: dh'a tv'a de:sha:sa: byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa'o //
translated: In dhātvā, it is deḥ śaḥ saḥ. The first of the roots is śa.

original: shi dhu lta bu byings kyi dang po sha yig ni sa yig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi dhu lta bu byings kyi dang po sha yig ni sa yig tu 'gyur te /

original: ` shi dhu 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: ` shi dhu 'gro ba la'o //

analyzed: shanydza chags pa /

original: aa ba snga ma las kyang stambhi'i sa yig brten ba dang mi ring ba'i don la 'jug ba na sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ba snga ma las kyang stambhi'i sa yig brten ba dang mi ring ba'i don la 'jug ba na sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The first ava, also, is changed to śa, when the syllable staṃbhi, which is not far from it, has the meaning of “to support.”

original: beshtsa sva no bho dza ni /
analyzed: beshtsa sva no bho dza ni /

original: bi las kyang sva na'i zas la'o //
analyzed: bi las kyang sva na'i zas la'o //

original: bi dang yang gi sgras aa ba sngon ma las kyang sva na ti zas kyi don la 'jug pa na sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bi dang yang gi sgras aa ba sngon ma las kyang sva na ti zas kyi don la 'jug pa na sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The first ava, also, is changed to śa, when it has the meaning of “food,” by the words vi and ca.

original: ba ri ni bi bhya: se ba si ta sa ya si ba sa ha sua stu shvanydz'am /
analyzed: ba ri ni bi bhya: se ba si ta sa ya si ba sa ha sua stu shvanydz'am /
translated: Varīṇi-vibhyaḥ, sevasitasyāyasya vasahasuṣṭuśvānam.

original: ba ri ni bi rnams las se ba si ta sa ya si ba sa ha stu shvanydza sut rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ba ri ni bi rnams las se ba si ta sa ya si ba sa ha stu shvanydza sut rnams kyi'o //

original: nyer bsgyur ba ri dang / ni dang bi rnams snga ma las /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur ba ri dang / ni dang bi rnams snga ma las /
translated: The prefixes varīṇi, ni, and vi are from the first.

original: byings se ba sogs te /
analyzed: byings se ba sogs te /

original: she bre 'thor ba /🔽si ta dang shinya 'ching ba /
analyzed: she bre 'thor ba / si ta dang shinya 'ching ba /
translated: Sevasit means “to scatter.”🔽Sit means “to bind.”

original: shi bu thags 'thag pa /
analyzed: shi bu thags 'thag pa /
translated: Śiv means “to weave.”

original: kha ha bzod pa /
analyzed: kha ha bzod pa /
translated: Kha means “to endure.”

original: shtunya bstod pa /
analyzed: shtunya bstod pa /
translated: Śatu means “to praise.”🔽Śvā means “to embrace.”

original: shvanydza 'khyud pa rnams dang sut dang 'brel pa'i sa yig rnams sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shvanydza 'khyud pa rnams dang sut dang 'brel pa'i sa yig rnams sha yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllables ya and sa are changed to śa when they are connected with su.

original: ni sngon ma'i shi dhu la lat sogs sbyar bas /
analyzed: ni sngon ma'i shi dhu la lat sogs sbyar bas /
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle śidhu, etc.

original: lat la / ni she dha ti sogs so //
analyzed: lat la / ni she dha ti sogs so //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle śedhati, etc.

original: ling la / ni she dhe ta sogs so //
analyzed: ling la / ni she dhe ta sogs so //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle liṅga, etc.

original: lot la / ni she dha tu sogs so //🔽braka si t'a da dya ba yo& pi /🔽si ta las dang por aat sa bar chod pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: lot la / ni she dha tu sogs so // braka si t'a da dya ba yo& pi / si ta las dang por aat sa bar chod pa las kyang ngo //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle loṭa, etc.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle brakasita, etc.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sita, etc., when preceded by a negative.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sita, etc., when preceded by a reason.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sita, etc., when preceded by a reason.

analyzed: nyer bsgyur rgyu mtshan can sngon na yod pa las si ta ste su no ti la sogs pa rnams kyis yig ni aat a'aga ma bar na yod pa @211a * // las kyang sha yig tu 'gyur te / lang la / n+ya shi dha ta sogs so //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sita, etc., when preceded by a negative.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle lāṅgala, etc.

original: lung la / n+ya she dh'ita sogs so //🔽sth'a di shva bhy'a se na ts'a bhy'a sa sya /🔽sth'a la sogs pa rnams la aa bhy'a sa yis kyang aa bhy'a sa'i 'o //
analyzed: lung la / n+ya she dh'ita sogs so // sth'a di shva bhy'a se na ts'a bhy'a sa sya / sth'a la sogs pa rnams la aa bhy'a sa yis kyang aa bhy'a sa'i 'o //
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle lung, etc.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sthā, etc., when preceded by a negative.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sthā, etc., when preceded by a negative.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sthā, etc., when preceded by a reason.

original: nyer bsgyur rgyu mtshan can snga ma las /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur rgyu mtshan can snga ma las /
translated: The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sthā, etc., when preceded by a reason.🔽The affix ṇini is added to the past passive participle sthā, etc., when preceded by a reason.

original: sth'a la sogs pa rnams kyi byings gnyis brjod pa aa bhy'a sa'i ming can yod na aa bhy'a sa de nyid sha yig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sth'a la sogs pa rnams kyi byings gnyis brjod pa aa bhy'a sa'i ming can yod na aa bhy'a sa de nyid sha yig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If there is a root such as sthā and so on that has two syllables and is called abhyāsa, that abhyāsa itself becomes the syllable śa.🔽In lita, niśiśe dha,🔽niśiśedatu, niśiśidhu,

original: lit la / ni shi she dha/...(mdo 'dis sa snga ma sha dang kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sa phyi ma sha/) ni shi she dha tu: ni shi shi dhu:...(brtsegs pa ma yin pa'i zhes pas 'dir lit kita yin pas yon tan mi byed/) sogs so //
analyzed: lit la / ni shi she dha/...(mdo 'dis sa snga ma sha dang kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sa phyi ma sha/) ni shi she dha tu: ni shi shi dhu:...(brtsegs pa ma yin pa'i zhes pas 'dir lit kita yin pas yon tan mi byed/) sogs so //
translated: and so on.

original: lut la / ni she dhi t'a sogs so //
analyzed: lut la / ni she dhi t'a sogs so //
translated: In luti, niśeditā, and so on.

original: smon pa'i ling la ni shi dhy'ata sogs so //🔽lrit la ni she dhi shya ti sogs dang / lring la n+ya she dhi shyata /
analyzed: smon pa'i ling la ni shi dhy'ata sogs so // lrit la ni she dhi shya ti sogs dang / lring la n+ya she dhi shyata /
translated: In the optative, niśidhyāt, and so on.

original: sogs so // se dha terga too //
analyzed: sogs so // se dha terga too //
translated: In lṛṭ, niśiśyate, and so on, and in lṛṅ, niśiśyate, and so on.🔽In the imperative, gacchati.

original: se dha ti 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: se dha ti 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Gacchati is going.

original: nyer bsgyur rgyu mtshan can sngon na yod kyang byings shi dha 'gyur ba'i sa yig ni 'gro ba'i don brjod pa la shar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur rgyu mtshan can sngon na yod kyang byings shi dha 'gyur ba'i sa yig ni 'gro ba'i don brjod pa la shar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Although the causative is present before, the syllable śa of the root śi, which changes to śa, does not change to śa in the expression of the meaning of going.

original: ni snga ma'i shi dha 'gro ba la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i /
analyzed: ni snga ma'i shi dha 'gro ba la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i /

original: lat la / ni se dha ti sogs te /
analyzed: lat la / ni se dha ti sogs te /
translated: The nominal suffixes are se, dhati, and so forth.

original: ngag tu sbyar na /

analyzed: sogs te sngas rnams dang 'dra la /

analyzed: lung lang lring sogs kyis byings la aat ta gnas don rjes 'brel phyis nas /

original: tsli'i sitsa 'os sitsar bsgyur /
analyzed: tsli'i sitsa 'os sitsar bsgyur /

translated: The u of the root is augmented in the case of the final consonants ca, ṭa, ta, pa, da, bha, ya, ra, la, and va.🔽The as of asti is augmented in the case of the si of sici.🔽Ta is the meaning of location.🔽In the case of kara, the ta is augmented as dha.🔽The dha of jhal is for jhal.🔽The si of sici, which is the case of the final consonant dha of the root, is destroyed by the jhal of the case ending, which is the first letter of the case ending jhal.🔽The dha of jhastha thor dho&dhaḥ is the dha of jha, which is not a dhamma.🔽🔽

original: byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa 'os sha sa /🔽lung lang lring sogs kyis byings la aat /
analyzed: byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa 'os sha sa / lung lang lring sogs kyis byings la aat /
translated: The first of the roots, śa, is changed to śa,🔽and the root is given the suffix -at by the rule of lang ling.

original: lung latsli 'os tsli byin /
analyzed: lung latsli 'os tsli byin /
translated: The suffix -i is added by the rule of tsli,

original: tsli'i si tsa 'os si tsar bsgyur /
analyzed: tsli'i si tsa 'os si tsar bsgyur /
translated: and the -i is changed to -i by the rule of sitsa.

original: bad bradza hal mtha' rnams kyi aatsa'i 'os byings 'phel ba rjes 'brel phyis nas la tas su bsgyur /
analyzed: bad bradza hal mtha' rnams kyi aatsa'i 'os byings 'phel ba rjes 'brel phyis nas la tas su bsgyur /
translated: The suffix -ac is added to the roots of the final -a, -da, and -dha by the rule of bda,

original: tas thas tha mi pa sogs kyis tas t'am du bsgyur /🔽dzhal gyi dzhal la 'os sitsa 'jig / mdo 'dis ta dhar bsgyur /
analyzed: tas thas tha mi pa sogs kyis tas t'am du bsgyur / dzhal gyi dzhal la 'os sitsa 'jig / mdo 'dis ta dhar bsgyur /
translated: and the -ac is changed to -a or -u by the rule of tdas tha tha mi pa.🔽The -ac of the -ac of the final -dha is changed to -i by the rule of sitsa,🔽and by this rule, -ta is changed to -dha.

original: dzha sha la dzhal rnams kyi dza sha 'os dha gong mdar bsgyur da drangs/) skyes bu dang po'i mang tshig la /
analyzed: dzha sha la dzhal rnams kyi dza sha 'os dha gong mdar bsgyur da drangs/) skyes bu dang po'i mang tshig la /
translated: For the plural of the first person,

original: aa seet+su:...(shidh'u ba /🔽lung / byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa 'os sa sha lung lang lring sogs kyis byings la aat /
analyzed: aa seet+su:...(shidh'u ba / lung / byings kyi dang po'i sha'i sa 'os sa sha lung lang lring sogs kyis byings la aat /
translated: there is asaitsu.🔽The first of the roots, śa, is changed to śa by the rule of lang ling,🔽and the root is given the suffix -at by the rule of lang ling.

original: lung la tsli 'os tsli byin tsli'i sitsa 'os sitsar bsgyur /🔽ai dang tsa phyis rjes 'brel phyis nas /
analyzed: lung la tsli 'os tsli byin tsli'i sitsa 'os sitsar bsgyur / ai dang tsa phyis rjes 'brel phyis nas /
translated: The suffix -i is added by the rule of tsli,🔽and the -i is changed to -i by the rule of sitsa.

original: la dzhir bsgyur /
analyzed: la dzhir bsgyur /
translated: The -i and -c are dropped, and the suffix is changed to -i by the rule of la jhi.

original: sitsa aa bhy'as bi di rnams las kyang ngos dzhi dzus su bsgyur /
analyzed: sitsa aa bhy'as bi di rnams las kyang ngos dzhi dzus su bsgyur /
translated: In the case of the Sitakaundinya, the zhi is changed to jhu in the vidya.

original: tsu tu sogs kyis dza phyis /
analyzed: tsu tu sogs kyis dza phyis /
translated: The cu and so on expel the ja.

original: bad bra dza hal mtha' rnams kyi aatsa'i 'os byings 'phel ba /
analyzed: bad bra dza hal mtha' rnams kyi aatsa'i 'os byings 'phel ba /
translated: The final a of the bhraja hal is increased to a.🔽The kar is changed to car, and the dhat is drawn in, in order.

original: khar la tsar 'os dha ta rim bzhin drangs/) skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: khar la tsar 'os dha ta rim bzhin drangs/) skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: For the three middle beings:🔽asesi, asesidham,

original: aa seet+s'i: aa seeddham /
analyzed: aa seet+s'i: aa seeddham /
translated: asesidha.

original: aa seeddha / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: aa seeddha / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: For the three latter beings:🔽asesittam, asesitv,

original: aa seet+sam / aa seet+sva /
analyzed: aa seet+sam / aa seet+sva /
translated: asesittam.

original: aa seet+sma / shi dh'u la lit pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /
analyzed: aa seet+sma / shi dh'u la lit pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /
translated: For the three first beings, when combined with Shivalilitaparasmai pada:

original: si se dha /
analyzed: si se dha /
translated: sesedha,🔽sesedhatu, sesedhu.

original: si se dha tu: si se dhu: skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig la ait yang na bar byas pas /
analyzed: si se dha tu: si se dhu: skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig la ait yang na bar byas pas /
translated: For the single word of the middle being, it is also made into a middle word:🔽sesedhatha,

original: si se dhi tha /🔽si seddha / skyes @212a * //
analyzed: si se dhi tha / si seddha / skyes @212a * //
translated: sesedha.

original: bu dbus ma'i gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
analyzed: bu dbus ma'i gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
translated: For the dual and plural words of the middle being:

original: si se dha thu: si se dha /
analyzed: si se dha thu: si se dha /
translated: sesedhatu, sesedha.

original: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /🔽si se dha /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la / si se dha /
translated: For the three latter beings:🔽sesedha,

original: si se dhva /
analyzed: si se dhva /
translated: sesedva.

original: (la bas / bas bar bsgyur dha drangs/) si se dhma/...(la mas /
analyzed: (la bas / bas bar bsgyur dha drangs/) si se dhma/...(la mas /
translated: The first three beings of the east, who give the syllable e, are connected with siddham.🔽The three middle beings are connected with siddham.🔽The last three beings are connected with siddham.🔽The first three beings of the south, who give the syllable ai, are connected with siddhitā.

original: mas mar bsgyur dha ma la drangs/) shi dh'u la lut pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar /
analyzed: mas mar bsgyur dha ma la drangs/) shi dh'u la lut pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar /
translated: The three middle beings are connected with siddhitāro.🔽The last three beings are connected with siddhitāraḥ.

original: aet yang na bar byas pa'i ait byin pa'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽se dhi t'a /🔽se dhi t'a roo /
analyzed: aet yang na bar byas pa'i ait byin pa'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la / se dhi t'a / se dhi t'a roo /
translated: The first three beings of the west, who give the syllable o, are connected with siddhitāsi.

original: se dhi t'a ra: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽se dhi t'a si /🔽se dhi t'astha: se dha t'astha /
analyzed: se dhi t'a ra: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la / se dhi t'a si / se dhi t'astha: se dha t'astha /
translated: The three middle beings are connected with siddhitāsthāḥ.

original: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /🔽se dhi t'a mi /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la / se dhi t'a mi /
translated: The last three beings are connected with siddhitāsmāḥ.🔽The first three beings of the north, who give the syllable au, are connected with siddham.🔽The three middle beings are connected with siddhamro.

original: se dhi t'a sva: se dhi t'asma: sogs so //
analyzed: se dhi t'a sva: se dhi t'asma: sogs so //
translated: The last three beings are connected with siddhamraḥ.

original: ait me ster ba'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽seddh'a / seddh'a roo /
analyzed: ait me ster ba'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la / seddh'a / seddh'a roo /
translated: The first three beings of the northeast, who give the syllable aṃ, are connected with siddham.

original: seddh'a ra:skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽seddh'a si / seddh'a si /🔽seddh'astha: seddh'astha / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: seddh'a ra:skyes bu dbus ma gsum la / seddh'a si / seddh'a si / seddh'astha: seddh'astha / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: The three middle beings are connected with siddhamsi.🔽The last three beings are connected with siddhamstḥaḥ.🔽The first three beings of the southeast, who give the syllable aḥ, are connected with siddham.🔽The three middle beings are connected with siddham.

original: seddh'a mi / seddh'a sva: seddh'asma:/
analyzed: seddh'a mi / seddh'a sva: seddh'asma:/
translated: The last three beings are connected with siddham.

original: shi dh'u la smon pa'i ling gi pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽si dhy'a ta /🔽si dhy'ast'am / si dhy'a su /
analyzed: shi dh'u la smon pa'i ling gi pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i skyes bu dang po gsum la / si dhy'a ta / si dhy'ast'am / si dhy'a su /
translated: The three first persons of the optative are formed by adding the desiderative particle ṭi to siddhu, siddhu, siddhu.

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la ;🔽si dhy'a: si dhy'astam /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la ; si dhy'a: si dhy'astam /
translated: The three middle persons are formed by adding ṭi to siddhyā, siddhyā, siddhyā.

original: si dhyasta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /🔽si dhy'a sam /🔽si dhy'a sva /
analyzed: si dhyasta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la / si dhy'a sam / si dhy'a sva /
translated: The three last persons are formed by adding ṭi to siddhyā, siddhyā, siddhyā.🔽The three first persons of the optative are formed by adding the desiderative particle ṭi to siddhu, siddhu, siddhu.🔽The three middle persons are formed by adding ṭi to siddhyā, siddhyā, siddhyā.🔽The three last persons are formed by adding ṭi to siddhyā, siddhyā, siddhyā.

original: si dhy'asma / shi dh'u la lrit pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ait ster ba dang mi ster ba 'dam ka can du byas pa'i ait sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽se dhi shya ti /🔽se dhi shya ta: se dhi shyanti /🔽skyes bu dbus ma gsum la ;
analyzed: si dhy'asma / shi dh'u la lrit pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ait ster ba dang mi ster ba 'dam ka can du byas pa'i ait sbyar ba'i phyogs kyi skyes bu dang po gsum la / se dhi shya ti / se dhi shya ta: se dhi shyanti / skyes bu dbus ma gsum la ;

original: byings ritstsha 'gro ba ma yin pa ste bor ba'i byings kyi dang po'i yi ge de aitsa so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yin pa aitsa'i yi ge de yang lci ba dang ldan pa de las pha rol tu lit 'gyur ba'i rnam @215a * //
analyzed: byings ritstsha 'gro ba ma yin pa ste bor ba'i byings kyi dang po'i yi ge de aitsa so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yin pa aitsa'i yi ge de yang lci ba dang ldan pa de las pha rol tu lit 'gyur ba'i rnam @215a * //
translated: The root ric is not a verb, and the first letter of the root is replaced by the letter iṭ, which is a letter of the iṭ class. That letter iṭ is heavy, and after it, the suffix liṭ is added.

original: dbye rnams byung na byings de'i mtha' la a'am rkyen du ster te skabs 'di'i ma yig ni gnas kyi don ma yin pas mi dbyi'o //
analyzed: dbye rnams byung na byings de'i mtha' la a'am rkyen du ster te skabs 'di'i ma yig ni gnas kyi don ma yin pas mi dbyi'o //
translated: If the case endings are added, the letter a or the case ending is added to the end of the root. In this context, the letter ma does not have the meaning of location, so it is not added.

original: a'a ma: a'am las so //
analyzed: a'a ma: a'am las so //
translated: From a or am.

original: byings la a'am sbyar ba'i pha las lit 'gyur pa'i rnam dbye thams cad 'jig go //🔽krinyts'a nu pra yu dzya te li ti /
analyzed: byings la a'am sbyar ba'i pha las lit 'gyur pa'i rnam dbye thams cad 'jig go // krinyts'a nu pra yu dzya te li ti /
translated: When the letter a is added to the root, all the suffixes that would have become liṭ are destroyed.🔽kṛtya anu prayujyate liṭi.

original: krinya'ang rjes su rab tu sbyor te lit la'o //
analyzed: krinya'ang rjes su rab tu sbyor te lit la'o //
translated: kṛtya is also added after.

original: byings a'am sbyar ba las krinya zhes pa so sor bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: byings a'am sbyar ba las krinya zhes pa so sor bsdu ba ste /
translated: The root with a added is kṛtya, which is a letter of the iṭ class.

original: kri bh'u aa sti rnams rjes su rab tu sbyor bar bya ste de rnams la lit'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kri bh'u aa sti rnams rjes su rab tu sbyor bar bya ste de rnams la lit'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: kṛ, bhū, and asti are added after, and to them, liṭ is also added.

original: au rata / ri'i aata'o //
analyzed: au rata / ri'i aata'o //
translated: u rat, ri aṭ.

original: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ri yig yin na aata du 'gyur te ra pha rol lo //
analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de ri yig yin na aata du 'gyur te ra pha rol lo //
translated: The first of the two roots expressed, which is named abhyāsa, is ri if it has the letter ri, it becomes at, which is the other.

original: lita'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
analyzed: lita'i pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig la /
translated: In the first person singular of the perfect of the verb lita,

original: aind'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: aind'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: there is indam or cakram.

original: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
analyzed: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
translated: In the second and third person plural,

original: aika gi aatsal yan 'os ri ra\ ru bsgyur bas aind'am tsakra tu: aind'am tsa kru:/🔽kri sri bhri bri stu dru sru shru bo li ti /
analyzed: aika gi aatsal yan 'os ri ra\ ru bsgyur bas aind'am tsakra tu: aind'am tsa kru:/ kri sri bhri bri stu dru sru shru bo li ti /
translated: the ri is changed to ru by the addition of the a of the a of the first person singular, so it becomes indam cakratuḥ, indam cakraḥ.🔽In the perfect of the verb lita, there is kṛṣṭa, bhṛṣṭa, bhrāṣṭa, dṛṣṭa, sṛṣṭa, śṛṣṭa, and bhoṭita.

original: lit la kri sri bhri bri stu dru sru shr'u las so //
analyzed: lit la kri sri bhri bri stu dru sru shr'u las so //
translated: In the perfect of lita, there is kṛṣṭa, bhṛṣṭa, bhrāṣṭa, dṛṣṭa, sṛṣṭa, and śṛṣṭa.

original: byings du krinya (ai di la /
analyzed: byings du krinya (ai di la /
translated: In the root du kṛtya

original: lit / ai 'gro ba la num 'os byings la num ma dang au phyis /
analyzed: lit / ai 'gro ba la num 'os byings la num ma dang au phyis /
translated: in the sense of going, the a of the first person singular is added to the root, and the u and ū are changed to m and ṃ.

original: ritstsha ma yin pa'i aitsa dang po las kyang lci ba ldan pa las sos byings la a'a ma sbyar /
analyzed: ritstsha ma yin pa'i aitsa dang po las kyang lci ba ldan pa las sos byings la a'a ma sbyar /
translated: Also, the first iṭ is changed to iṭ by the addition of the heavy vowel, and the a of the heavy vowel is added to the root.

original: a'a ma las sos lit 'jig / aind'am zhes pa grub /
analyzed: a'a ma las sos lit 'jig / aind'am zhes pa grub /
translated: The a of the heavy vowel is elided, and indam is formed.

original: krinya'ang rjes su rab tu sbyor te lit la'o zhes pas kri sbyar lit la 'os kri la lit sbyar /
analyzed: krinya'ang rjes su rab tu sbyor te lit la'o zhes pas kri sbyar lit la 'os kri la lit sbyar /
translated: Also, kṛ is applied after, so it is kṛta.

original: lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
analyzed: lit la byings aa bhy'a sa med pa'i 'os byings gnyis brjod /
translated: The two roots abhyā and as are applied to lit.

original: mdo 'dis ri aar dang ra pha rol /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ri aar dang ra pha rol /
translated: By this sūtra, ri and ar are the other side.

original: hal dang po lhag po'os ra yang phyis /
analyzed: hal dang po lhag po'os ra yang phyis /
translated: Hal and pa are the remainder.🔽Ku and ha are applied to cu.

original: ku ha dag gi tsu 'os ka tsa rjes 'brel phyis nas /🔽la tib du bsgyur /
analyzed: ku ha dag gi tsu 'os ka tsa rjes 'brel phyis nas / la tib du bsgyur /
translated: Ka and ca are connected and removed.

original: pa rasmee pa da rnams kyi zhes zhes pas tip nal du bsgyur /🔽nya na 'gro ba la aatsa'i 'os /
analyzed: pa rasmee pa da rnams kyi zhes zhes pas tip nal du bsgyur / nya na 'gro ba la aatsa'i 'os /
translated: The sūtra “pa and ra are applied to smṛ” changes pa and ra to smṛ.🔽The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gati” changes na and ya to gati.🔽The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gam” changes na and ya to gam.

original: ri a'a / ri'i aa na las ra pha rol 'os /🔽ra a'a ga ma /🔽ra aa la drangs/) byed pa sri 'gro ba bhrinya 'gengs pa /
analyzed: ri a'a / ri'i aa na las ra pha rol 'os / ra a'a ga ma / ra aa la drangs/) byed pa sri 'gro ba bhrinya 'gengs pa /
translated: The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gati” changes na and ya to gati.🔽The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gam” changes na and ya to gam.

original: brinya sgrib pa /🔽shtunya bstod pa /🔽dru dang sru 'gro ba /
analyzed: brinya sgrib pa / shtunya bstod pa / dru dang sru 'gro ba /
translated: The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gati” changes na and ya to gati.🔽The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gam” changes na and ya to gam.🔽The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gati” changes na and ya to gati.

original: shru thos pa rnams las pha rol gyi lit la ait 'jug pa ma yin te /🔽lita'i skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig la /🔽aind'am tsa kartha /
analyzed: shru thos pa rnams las pha rol gyi lit la ait 'jug pa ma yin te /🔽lita'i skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig la /🔽aind'am tsa kartha /
translated: The sūtra “na and ya are applied to gam” changes na and ya to gam.

original: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
analyzed: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
translated: For the dual and plural,

analyzed: aind'am tsakra thu: aind'am tsakra /

analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma'i gcig tshig la 'phel ba yang na bar byas pas / aind'am tsak'a ra /

original: aind'am tsa ka ra /
analyzed: aind'am tsa ka ra /

original: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /🔽aind'am tsa kri ba /
analyzed: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la / aind'am tsa kri ba /

analyzed: aind'am zhes bsgrubs pa la bh'u dang aasti lit dang bcas pa sbyar bar bya ste /

analyzed: aind'am ba bh'u ba tu: aind'am ba bh'u bu: sogs so //

original: lut la / nindi t'a sogs dang / smon pa'i ling la nandy'a ta sogs so //🔽lrit la / nindi shya ti sogs so //
analyzed: lut la / nindi t'a sogs dang / smon pa'i ling la nandy'a ta sogs so // lrit la / nindi shya ti sogs so //
translated: aindīṣyati, aindīṣyate, aindīṣyām.🔽The three future forms of the third person are:🔽aindīṣyati, aindīṣyate, aindīṣyām.🔽The three future forms of the third person are:

original: lring la / aa nindi shyata sogs so //
analyzed: lring la / aa nindi shyata sogs so //
translated: aindīṣyati, aindīṣyate, aindīṣyām.🔽The three future forms of the third person are:

original: b'a ninsa niksha nind'am /
analyzed: b'a ninsa niksha nind'am /
translated: aindīṣyati, aindīṣyate, aindīṣyām.

original: ninsa niksha ninda rnams kyi yang na'o //
analyzed: ninsa niksha ninda rnams kyi yang na'o //
translated: The three future forms of the third person are:🔽aindīṣyati, aindīṣyate, aindīṣyām.

original: nyer bsgyur na nar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan tshan can snga ma las byings na si dang niksha'o byed ba la'o zhes pa gnyis dang / bshad ma thag pa ni di smad pa gsum gyi na 'gyur ba'i slar na na yig tu yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur na nar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan tshan can snga ma las byings na si dang niksha'o byed ba la'o zhes pa gnyis dang / bshad ma thag pa ni di smad pa gsum gyi na 'gyur ba'i slar na na yig tu yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The two reasons for the change of the prefix are: “The root has na and the prefix has ni or kṣa,” and “The root has na and the prefix has na.”

original: pra ninda ti/...(rab tu smad par byed/) pra ninda ti lta bu'o //
analyzed: pra ninda ti/...(rab tu smad par byed/) pra ninda ti lta bu'o //
translated: The just-mentioned [reason] is the change of na to na, or to na, of the three [prefixes] di, vi, and u.

original: ` byings au @216a * //
analyzed: ` byings au @216a * //
translated: The root u

original: kha 'gro ba'i don la'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: kha 'gro ba'i don la'o zhes pa la /
translated: means “to go.”

original: lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga rnams kyang lita'i skabs su cung zad ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /🔽lat la / ao kha ti /
analyzed: lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga rnams kyang lita'i skabs su cung zad ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste / lat la / ao kha ti /
translated: The rules for applying the suffixes la, etc., to rasmi, etc., are similar to the previous ones, except for a few differences in the case of la.🔽To la, [add] o, khati, etc.

original: sogs so // ling la /
analyzed: sogs so // ling la /
translated: To ling,

original: ao kheta sogs so //🔽lot la / ao kha tu sogs so ;
analyzed: ao kheta sogs so // lot la / ao kha tu sogs so ;

original: / lang la aoo khata /🔽sogs so / lung la /
analyzed: / lang la aoo khata / sogs so / lung la /

analyzed: aoo kh'ati / sogs so // aa bhy'a sa sy'a sa barne /

original: aa bhy'a sa'i 'dra ba ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa'i 'dra ba ma yin pa la'o //

original: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de hal gyi srog tu zhugs pa ma yin pa'i au dang ai yig gang rung yin la /
analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po aa bhy'a sa'i ming can de hal gyi srog tu zhugs pa ma yin pa'i au dang ai yig gang rung yin la /
translated: The first of the two roots that express “to go” is called abhyāsa. It has either the vowel u or i, which is not the life-force of hal.

original: de'i pha rol tu aatsa 'dra ba ma yin pa byung na au ni aubra dang aini ai ya\ zhes par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu aatsa 'dra ba ma yin pa byung na au ni aubra dang aini ai ya\ zhes par 'gyur /
translated: If what follows it is not like a vowel a, then u becomes ubra and i becomes iya.

original: (aatsa dang po rnams kyi a'at 'os /
analyzed: (aatsa dang po rnams kyi a'at 'os /

original: byings la a'att gnas don /
analyzed: byings la a'att gnas don /

original: a'at las kyang aatsa'i 'os 'phel ba/) te ;
analyzed: a'at las kyang aatsa'i 'os 'phel ba/) te ;

analyzed: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /

analyzed: aanytsi t'a / sogs so // smon pa'i ling la /
translated: In Lit, “to go” is anac, etc.🔽In the optative, Ling has kit.

original: smon pa la kita'o zhes pas rnam @216b dbye rnams kita yin pas /🔽aanytsa 'gro ba la 'jug pa na aanytsa'i mchod pa la ma yin no zhes pas na mi dbyi ste /
analyzed: smon pa la kita'o zhes pas rnam @216b dbye rnams kita yin pas / aanytsa 'gro ba la 'jug pa na aanytsa'i mchod pa la ma yin no zhes pas na mi dbyi ste /
translated: Since the optative has kit,🔽when anac is used for “to go,” it is not used for “to worship.”

original: 'gro ba la /🔽aa tsy'ata sogs dang / mchod pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba la / aa tsy'ata sogs dang / mchod pa la /

original: aanytsy'ata sogs so //🔽lrit la / aanytsi shya ti sogs so //
analyzed: aanytsy'ata sogs so // lrit la / aanytsi shya ti sogs so //
translated: In “to worship,” it is anacay, etc.🔽In Lrit, “to go” is anacisya, etc.

original: lring la / a'anytsi shyata sogs so /
analyzed: lring la / a'anytsi shyata sogs so /
translated: In Ling, “to go” is anacisya, etc.

original: ` / mru tsu 'gro ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga rnams kyang lung gi skabs su tsli aang du bsgyur ba dang si tsar bsgyur ba ('gro bar shog) 'dam ka can du (mchod par shog) byed pa tsam🔽ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /🔽lat la / mrotsa ti sogs so //🔽ling la / mro tsata sogs so //
analyzed: ` / mru tsu 'gro ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga rnams kyang lung gi skabs su tsli aang du bsgyur ba dang si tsar bsgyur ba ('gro bar shog) 'dam ka can du (mchod par shog) byed pa tsam ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste / lat la / mrotsa ti sogs so // ling la / mro tsata sogs so //
translated: The rules for applying the affixes lat and so forth to the root mruc, meaning “to go,” are the same as the previous ones, except that in the context of scripture, the word is translated as cīr aṅga and the word sita is translated as “may they go” or “may they be worshipped.”🔽The affixes lat and so forth are applied to mruc.🔽The affixes ling and so forth are applied to mruc.

original: lot la / mo tsa tu sogs so //
analyzed: lot la / mo tsa tu sogs so //
translated: The affixes lot and so forth are applied to mruc.

original: lang la aa mro tsata sogs so //
analyzed: lang la aa mro tsata sogs so //
translated: The affixes lang and so forth are applied to amruc.

original: dzr'i stambhu mru tsu mlu tsu gru tsu glu tsu glunytsu shvi bhyashtsa /
analyzed: dzr'i stambhu mru tsu mlu tsu gru tsu glu tsu glunytsu shvi bhyashtsa /
translated: From the roots jṛ, stāmbhu, mruc, mruc, gruc, gluc, gluñc, and śvībhyaḥ.

original: dzr'i stambhu mru tsu mlu tsu gru tsu glu tsu glunytsu shvi rnams las kyang ngo //
analyzed: dzr'i stambhu mru tsu mlu tsu gru tsu glu tsu glunytsu shvi rnams las kyang ngo //
translated: From the roots jṛ, stāmbhu, mruc, mruc, gruc, gluc, gluñc, and śvībhyaḥ.

original: byings dzr'i lang tsho nyams pa /
analyzed: byings dzr'i lang tsho nyams pa /

original: tambhu mdo'i byings /🔽mru tsu gru tsu glunytsu rnams 'gro ba /
analyzed: tambhu mdo'i byings / mru tsu gru tsu glunytsu rnams 'gro ba /
translated: The root stāmbhu means “to be firm.”🔽The roots mruc, gruc, and gluñc mean “to go.”

original: mlu tsu dang glu tsu dag rku bar byed pa /
analyzed: mlu tsu dang glu tsu dag rku bar byed pa /
translated: The roots mruc and gluc mean “to steal.”

original: tu ao shvi 'gro ba dang 'phel ba dag la'o zhes pa rnams las kyang tsli aang du yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: tu ao shvi 'gro ba dang 'phel ba dag la'o zhes pa rnams las kyang tsli aang du yang na 'gyur te /

analyzed: lung gi pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /

analyzed: aa mru tsa t'am /

analyzed: aa mru tsan sogs so //

analyzed: lut la / mro tsi t'a / mro tsi t'a roo / mro tsi t'a ra:sogs so // smon pa'i ling la /

analyzed: mlu tsa grutsu glutsu glunytsu rnams kyang cho ga thams cad bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra zhing smon pa'i ling gi skabs su glunytsu'i nya yig dbyi'o //
translated: The rules for the formation of the words mṛdu, mṛdu, mṛdu, and mṛdu are similar to the explanation of all the rules above. In the section on the desiderative, the ya of mṛdu is elided.

original: lung la / a'anytsh'ita sogs so //
analyzed: lung la / a'anytsh'ita sogs so //
translated: In lṛṅ, the forms are ācīrṇit, ācīrṇavān, and so on.

translated: ājñā, ājñātam,🔽ājñā,🔽ājiṣṇam,🔽ājiṣva,

original: a'a dzi shva /🔽a'a dzishma / aa dza b'i ra 'gyur ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: a'a dzi shva / a'a dzishma / aa dza b'i ra 'gyur ba'i phyogs la /

original: si tsi briddhi: pa rasmee ba de shu /🔽sitsa la 'phel ba pa rasmee pa da rnams la'o //
analyzed: si tsi briddhi: pa rasmee ba de shu / sitsa la 'phel ba pa rasmee pa da rnams la'o //
translated: sicit-pradīpta-parasmṛti-pradīpa-deśaḥ,

original: byings mtha' aig so sor bsdu ba yin na si tsa rnam dbye pa rasmee pa da dang bcas pa pha rol la 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings mtha' aig so sor bsdu ba yin na si tsa rnam dbye pa rasmee pa da dang bcas pa pha rol la 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the final syllable of a root is i, and it is a class 1 or 2 root, and it is in the parasmaipada, then sicit-pradīpta-parasmṛti-pradīpa-deśaḥ will be added to the root.

original: lung gi skyes bu dang po gsum la /
analyzed: lung gi skyes bu dang po gsum la /
translated: For the first three persons of the optative,

original: aa bee sh'i ta /
analyzed: aa bee sh'i ta /
translated: avīṣṭa,

original: aa beesht'am / aa bee shu:/
analyzed: aa beesht'am / aa bee shu:/
translated: avīṣṭam, avīṣu,

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: For the middle three persons,🔽avīṣi, avīṣṭam,

original: aa bee sh'i:/ aa bee shtam /
analyzed: aa bee sh'i:/ aa bee shtam /
translated: avīṣṭa,

original: aa beeshta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /🔽aa bee sh'am /🔽aa bee shva /
analyzed: aa beeshta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la / aa bee sh'am / aa bee shva /
translated: For the last three persons,🔽avīṣam,🔽avīṣva,

original: aa bee shma /
analyzed: aa bee shma /
translated: avīṣma,

original: li ta'i skyes bu dang po @218b gsum la /
analyzed: li ta'i skyes bu dang po @218b gsum la /
translated: For the first three persons of the optative,

original: bi b'a ya /
analyzed: bi b'a ya /
translated: vivāya,

original: bi bya tu: bi bhu: aa tsast'a svattha lya ni to ni tyam /
analyzed: bi bya tu: bi bhu: aa tsast'a svattha lya ni to ni tyam /
translated: vibyatu, vibhu, acasattathālyato nityaṃ,

original: aatsa las t'as 'dra bar thal la ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: aatsa las t'as 'dra bar thal la ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The suffix ta is like ta, but ita is not always so.

original: byings aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten ha la med pa las t'as dang 'dra ba ste thal la ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byings aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten ha la med pa las t'as dang 'dra ba ste thal la ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The suffix ta is like ta, but ita is not always so, from the single-Aci base without a final support ha.

original: ri ta bh'ar dv'a dza sya /
analyzed: ri ta bh'ar dv'a dza sya /
translated: ritabharadvājasya

original: rita las dh'a ra dv'a dza'i 'o//
analyzed: rita las dh'a ra dv'a dza'i 'o//
translated: From rit, dhara and dvājasya.

original: gong du t'as dang thal dag la byings aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten hal med pa las ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes byung yang de'i dmigs pas la byings rita mtha' rnams dang aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten hal med pa las kyang thal dang t'as dang
analyzed: gong du t'as dang thal dag la byings aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten hal med pa las ait rtag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes byung yang de'i dmigs pas la byings rita mtha' rnams dang aatsa gcig pa mtha' rten hal med pa las kyang thal dang t'as dang
translated: Although it was said above that from the single-Aci base without a final support ha, ta and thal are like ta, but ita is not always so, by the observation of that, from the single-Aci base without a final support ha, thal and ta🔽and from the first bal, ita is also applied, the ancient sage Bharadvāja asserts.

original: bal dang po rnams las kyang ait 'jug bar sngon gyi drang srong bh'a ra dv'a dza 'dod do zhes byung bas thal gyi skabs 'dir gzugs gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: bal dang po rnams las kyang ait 'jug bar sngon gyi drang srong bh'a ra dv'a dza 'dod do zhes byung bas thal gyi skabs 'dir gzugs gsum 'byung ste /
translated: Since it was said that, in this context of thal, three forms occur,

original: bal dang po'i byings phyed pa la yang na bar 'dod do zhes pas /
analyzed: bal dang po'i byings phyed pa la yang na bar 'dod do zhes pas /
translated: and since it was said that the first half of the base bal is also asserted to be in the middle,

original: aa dza b'i ru 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang na ba dang / b'i ru 'gyur ba'i phyogs la mdo 'di gnyis kyis ait yang na bar byas pas /
analyzed: aa dza b'i ru 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba yang na ba dang / b'i ru 'gyur ba'i phyogs la mdo 'di gnyis kyis ait yang na bar byas pas /
translated: In the case of the change of ā to aj, or not changing, or the side of the change of ā to ai, the two sūtras make ā into ai.🔽ājiṭha

original: a'a dzitha / bi pa yi tha /
analyzed: a'a dzitha / bi pa yi tha /
translated: vipayiṭha

original: bi be tha /
analyzed: bi be tha /
translated: vibeyṭha

original: skyes bu dbus ma'i gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma'i gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
translated: In the case of the dual and plural of the middle person,🔽vibyaṭhu

original: bi bya thu: bi bya /
analyzed: bi bya thu: bi bya /
translated: vibya

original: skyes bu phyi ma'i gcig tshig la 'phel pa dang yon tan yang na bar byas pas /🔽bi b'a ya /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma'i gcig tshig la 'phel pa dang yon tan yang na bar byas pas / bi b'a ya /
translated: In the case of the singular of the last person, the augment is added or the quality is made ai.🔽vibayā

original: bi ba ya /
analyzed: bi ba ya /
translated: vibayi

original: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
analyzed: gnyis tshig dang mang tshig la /
translated: In the case of the dual and plural,🔽the change of ā to aj or remaining as ā is made ai.

original: b'i ru 'gyur ba dang aa dza nyid du gnas pa yang na bar byas pas a'a dzi ba /
analyzed: b'i ru 'gyur ba dang aa dza nyid du gnas pa yang na bar byas pas a'a dzi ba /
translated: ājiva

original: a'a dzi ma /
analyzed: a'a dzi ma /
translated: ājim

original: b'i ru 'gyur ba'i phyogs la ait yang na bar byas pas /🔽bi ba yi ba /
analyzed: b'i ru 'gyur ba'i phyogs la ait yang na bar byas pas / bi ba yi ba /
translated: In the case of the side of the change of ā to ai,🔽vibayiva

original: bi ba yim /
analyzed: bi ba yim /

analyzed: ait med pa'i phyogs la /
